result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominick Dwan Pearson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Endangering Safety by Use of Dangerous Weapon (Under the Influence of Intoxicant), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory costs, surcharges and assessments over period of probation in case 13CF2661. Upon revocation or successful completion any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.

Upon successful completion of probation, the court will consider motion for expungement fo count 1 only, Motion to expunge count 2 denied.
Concurrent with: AS TO EACH COUNT:  each count concurrent and concurrent with count 2 in 13CF2661.   Huber privileges for work and treatment, conditional upon absolute sobriety.  Credit for 61 days.

Concurrent with: AS STATED IN COUNT ONE.

records.addlTxt: Order amending JOC to reflect restitution in the amount of $450.00 owed to Rita B. as ordered by Judge Yamahiro on 3-10-14.  Notice to parties.  alp

Defendant Dominick D Pearson in court with attorney Charles L. Glynn.  Defendant Dominick D Pearson in custody.  Tyrone Martin St Junior for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing statements heard.
Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, each count concurrent and concurrent with count 2 in 13cf2661, with credit for 61 days each count and Huber privileges for work and treatment, conditional upon absolute sobriety.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory costs, surcharges and assessments over period of probation in case 13cf2661.  Upon revocation or successful completion any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant

Filed,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  kmw
*****
Upon successful completion of probation, the court will consider motion for expungement of count 1 only.  Motion to expunge count 2 denied.  kmw

Defendant Dominick Dwan Pearson in court with attorney Charles L Glynn.  Defendant Dominick Dwan Pearson in custody.  James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Count 3:  Dismissed and read-in
Counts 1 and 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Per Atty request, plea rescheduled to FEBRUARY 21, 2014, 1:30pm.  kmw

Defendant Dominick Dwan Pearson in court with attorney Charles L Glynn.  Defendant Dominick Dwan Pearson in custody.  James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dominick Dwan Pearson in court with attorney Charles L Glynn.  Defendant Dominick Dwan Pearson in custody.  James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Arraignment scheduled for January 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RITA B., ERICA S., AND 2113 S 75TH ST., WEST ALLIS, WI.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for ENHANCED SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dominick Dwan Pearson in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Dominick Dwan Pearson in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant pled not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNTS 1 & 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge YAMAHIRO, Branch 34.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
